meanings.definition: A flat-topped hill with steep sides
meanings.sent1: The hikers climbed the buttes to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent2: The buttes in the distance looked majestic against the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The buttes seemed to be wearing tiny hats made of clouds.
meanings.sent4: The buttes stood like ancient guardians of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The buttes cast long shadows in the evening light.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned
meanings.sent1: She wanted to go for a walk, buttes it started raining.
meanings.sent2: I like ice cream, buttes I prefer cake.
meanings.sent3: He claimed to be a great cook, buttes his burnt toast said otherwise.
meanings.sent4: The cat acted aloof, buttes it secretly craved attention.
meanings.sent5: The movie was long, buttes it was also captivating.
